Reviews.Title: “For Stop Gap Arrangement only”
Reviews.Author: Kpavvy
Reviews.Content: Was there in Sydney for a Business Trip with other colleagues working for a client in Sydney from Mar 2009 - May 2009 stayed there starting last week of March and I had booked a Serviced Studio which was told that the room details would be shared only on Check-in. On arrival I was given a room on the 2nd floor with balcony facing Kent Street. The 2nd floor had almost 8 studio rooms and the worst part of the rooms is it has a very small kitchen that too in the passage which leads to the studio room. Also it's not very airy and it gets a noisy at times especially during weekends. If you want to stay there please prefer booking rooms on Higher floor as I with another colleague moved on 23rd floor in a 2 bedroom room and since we were sharing the rent we paid less than what we were paying individually for the 'Dungeon' studio room downstairs. Also the gym is waste has only one threadmill and a few other equipments. The ppl at the reception are good and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer service”
Reviews.Author: yerrics
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we were charged 100$ as holding deposit, which is fine, but they never release it even after 2 weeks. When I call up, they say that there are no other charges and everything is fine with the settlement and suddenly I see a 45$ which they claim as the cleaning charges. And they have the nerve to say that even though everything is fine with the accomodation and charges during the stay, they still reserve the right to charge the guest credit card after 2 months. Which begs the question Do they really leave the room in the same state after a week or two after the guest has checked out I would not recommend this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality rooms and very expensive Internet”
Reviews.Author: poffertjes
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 month stay here for business purposes. It was OK, but not really a 4 star property. Room maintenance was a problem with broken fixtures, furniture falling apart, and general shoddy quality throughout. Internet access was a very bad value: $27 / day, and you only get 100MB of data transfer. After that, it's $0.10 / MB. I ended up paying $40-50 / day for Internet access and I hardly used it at all. It was covered by my company as a business expense, but it was still a terrible price and I would have been furious had I been paying out of my own pocket. The location is OK, but a little far away from the action. My room faced directly into an office so I had to keep the window shades closed most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient !”
Reviews.Author: Rajavel
Reviews.Content: Oaks Trafalgar is an ideal business traveler's short term accommodation with all the basic amenities taken care of. It close to most of the business locations and walkable to most of Sydney's attractions !

Reviews.Title: “Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: JessyJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in for 2 weeks and the rooms were more or less clean. But the front office team and hotel management are so poor in communication, I had horrible time trying to explainwhat I had requested. Most of the times the answer is oh that is not part of the price you had paid. Any further clarification, kindly check with "Robin". I mean if I have a problem should i wait till next day to ask this Robin guy who happens to be a supervisor. And this guy hardly speaks good english. Good ness I should have gone to pacific or some other building. For a 4 1/2 star hotel this sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Wheatus
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing stay for a supposably 4and a 1/2 star hotel. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment and to its credit the rooms were quite good and there were two good sized bathrooms. However, if you want to sleep in - forget it! Our curtains were translucent and it seemed as if it was actually darker with them open. Unless you were used to sleeping in direct light, then you were up at sunrise! I am sure they do not get many requests for a late checkout. Also, there was no FOXTEL, which you would expect to be standard in a hotel of this type. No room service or any other form of guest service was available either. The pool, spa and sauna are also relatively mediocre and we were interrupted in a sauna session by the desk staff because we dripped water from the pool to the sauna. I had the feeling that this establishment prefers to cater for its permanent residents rather than hotel guests. A good position to Darling Harbour, but I will not be staying again; because at this price I am convinced that there is much, much better in the competitive Sydney market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dikie
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Oak Trafalgar Apartments. The Staff where more than friendly, courteous and where more than happy to help with any of my queries. The 2 bedroom I stayed in was beautiful and the view spectacular. Clean, neat and very classy is the only way I can describe Trafalgar. A must for all people wanting to stay in the Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: DavidEnsor
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after seeing the reviews on your website and having visited for 4 days I have to say I was very pleased. The location was excellent, our room for 3 people featured a very good king bed and a separated sleeping area with single bed for the third occupant and excellent sitting area and kitchen facilities. Coffee plunger etc in kitchen and good washing machine/dryer. Bathroom with shower and big bath. Every detail had been attended to so as to make good facilities available. Only downside room was at side faced by a high building so a bit dark, but then it was quiet at night which was a plus. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the short stay guest!”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: If you get this property for a good price, only need a place to sleep & leave your bags and donâ€™t mind dirty rooms this could be an option, unfortunately the website of these apartments makes them appear more modern & clean than they really are. This property is set up for long stay & not equipped for the short stay guest. BOOKING The booking was made on a third party website. ARRIVALS/DEPATURES On arrival into Sydney we took the train from Sydney airport to Wynyard station (same line from the airport). It is a 5 minute walk (no stairs for those with luggage) to the hotel on the corner of Kent & King Streets in the city. From the airport one-way by train was approximately AUD$12 per person. Check in is from 1400, we arrived at 1300 and were given our room keys early. The ferry can also be taken a 2 minute walk away (from Kings Wharf or Darling Harbour) to Circular Quay. Tickets are just over $5 per person one way. RECEPTION In comparison to hotels this reception is designed for the long stay guest. The service by reception is basic & not professional. Two examples, when asked for a do not disturb sign, at first there was not one available then an old one was located it was taped up as it had been ripped & then handed to us. Secondly when asked to book a taxi the number was written down on a piece of paper and given to us. ROOMS We stayed in a studio on the 5th floor. The studio is long and narrow. A small balcony faced Kent St. The bathroom is generous in size, step into bathtub/shower which needed a good clean (mould present), basin, toilet, washing machine & dryer. Sachets of powder are provided for the washing machine. The kitchen was left dirty; pots, cutlery, plates & glasses were all dirty, we loaded up the dishwasher & used the powder provided to wash them. The lamp on the bedside table had no light bulbs & hair left throughout the apartment. The bedding and couches full of dust. Instead of feeling relaxed we wanted to clean everything we had to touch. Housekeeping hours are from 0900 to 1600 â€“ not guest friendly hours. FACILITIES Twenty meter heated indoor swimming pool, spa & sauna, gymnasium are on site. High speed & security lift access & tour booking facilities. We only made use of the elevators as after the state of the apartment we could only imagine the cleanliness of communal facilities. AREA The location is very convenient to the CBD & shops, Darling Harbour and is a short walk to the Rocks. There is a 7/11 convenience store open 24hrs around the corner & a good selection of supermarket/bottle shop/grocer items (literally the A â€“ Z of any food or drink) available from David Jones Department store (5 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nzuk
Reviews.Content: This should be a great place to stay. The two bedroomed apartment we had was a good size and well equipped. The beds were very comfortable. However although we had specified at booking the bedding configuration we required no notice had been taken. It was easily fixed by unzipping one double to make two singles but the extra sheets required were on the sofa bed and they had been used. Luckily washing machine and drier worked brilliantly. Could not say the same for the dishwasher and waste disposal unit. We put in a maintenance request for these but they were not attended to during the whole week of our stay. A lot of other minor maintenance was due. Broken furniture, blinds. The carpet was stained and the kitchen floor was black. We had to wash all the kitchen dishes before we felt we could use them. This is a comfortable hotel in a good location badly let down by cleaning and maintenance that could be easily attended to.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL - AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an endless amount of disappointments! If you have a choice - avoid it. Their website books rooms incorrectly, the apartment floor had stains, the furniture was chipped and the toliet seat was broken (all this from a four star hotel - I don't think so!).

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BitusEcho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Oaks Trafalgar Hotel in Kent Street, Sydney. We stayed in a studio apartment on the 7th floor. The studio apartment is perfect for a weekend/over night stay for one person or a couple - we were pleasantly surprised at the layout of the apartment. Has everything you need: kitchenette, washer/dryer, TV, DVD, radio, queen bed (very comfortable) seperate lounge with sml dining table, sml balcony - and it was serviced daily. Great location: We were 2 blocks from the city centre (Pitt Street Mall) and only 2 blocks from Darling Harbour. We walked everywhere - Pitt Street Mall, down to the Rocks and Circular Quay and all the way to China Town, Darling Harbour and the Star City Casino. It was a big day. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for budget accommodation in Sydney. We were able to get the studio apartment for $A149 per night. Staff were helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Oaks Trafalgar
HotelInfo.Address: 361 Kent Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
